Title: Confucius
Original title: Kong Zi
Country: China
China Premiere: 28 January 2010
UK Premiere: 24 September 2010
Released in Spain: 22 June 2011
Released on DVD (rental): 19/10/2011
Studio: Dadi Century Film
Director: Hu Mei
Screenplay: Hu Mei
Starring: Chow Yun-Fat, Daoming Chen, Zhou Xun, Lu Yi, Yao Lu, Chen Jianbin, Kaili Zhang, Jiao Huang, Ren Quan, Wang Ban


Synopsis:
'Confucius' focus in recent years in the life of influential Chinese philosopher, period covered since taking political office at 51, until his death at the age of 73 years, a period which takes place apotheosis story clashes between the Chinese states. Born in 551 B.C. died a very important man for Chinese culture. It was a time where many wars were fought between the kingdoms of China. Lu King is assisted by Confucius who uses his intelligence and charisma to calm your state of internal conflict and endless wars. But the great powers of the state feel threatened by the philosopher, Confucius so voluntarily going into exile.

Production notes:
Hu Mei, renowned director of the acclaimed and award-winning historical series "Yong Zheng Dynasty" and "The Emperor in Han Dynasty" directs this biopic about the life of the Chinese philosopher Confucius, played by the legendary Chow Yun Fat.
